results.title: The Dam builders
results.creator_credit: Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works and Cine Service
results.brief_description: Gives a brief history of the Melbourne water supply system and the efforts of the MMBW to create enjoyable environments such as landscaping and recreation facilities in several catchment areas. Highlights the construction of the Cardinia Reservoir, near Emerald, now the largest storage area for Melbourne.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works and Cine Service

results.title: Applause please
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal and Experimental Film & Television Fund
results.brief_description: This film makes a personal statement on TV and commercial advertising and their insidious effect on the susceptibility of people. The message is given using an avant-garde style, told in mime and dramatics. Cast includes Max Gillies, Joe Bolza and Bob Thorneycroft and original music performed by Frank Zappa.

results.title: Cricket: Australian style
results.creator_credit: Neil Howe, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A documentary on cricket as it is played in Australia in 1974. Offers highlights from a match between Australia and New Zealand and presents comments about the game by the then Australian captain Ian Chappell.

results.title: Round and around
results.creator_credit: Ivan Gaal, Ross Campbell and Victoria. Audio-Visual Education Centre
results.brief_description: Produced for use in primary schools to stimulate interest in Melbourne’s annual Royal Agricultural Show. Shows without commentary all the hectic activity of displays, sideshows and the excitement of the Grand Parade.

results.title: The Secondary Teacher
results.creator_credit: E.J. Perry and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: Describes the life of secondary student teachers in training: accommodation in a boarding house in Armadale, Victoria, for those from the country areas; Melbourne University and the various courses available for students. Also gives details about specialised couses and shows classes in progress. Shows the science, commerce, music and engineering faculties. Narrated by Terry Dear and animation by the Owen Brothers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: E.J. Perry and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.description: Describes the life of secondary student teachers in training: accommodation in a boarding house in Armadale, Victoria, for those from the country areas; Melbourne University and the various courses available for students. results.title: Australian report
results.creator_credit: Ian Hart, Keith Gow, David Eastman and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: A lighthearted look at Australia in 1973 - its history, industry and tourist attractions. Commments upon the high degree of urbanisation, the enormous mineral reserves and industrial growth and the opportunities which exist for vacationers in both rural and coastal areas. Also looks at the breakdown of isolation through instant electronic communications and air travel. No other credits available.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ian Hart, Keith Gow, David Eastman and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Australian army at war 1939-1945 (Episode 2)
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “War Experience”.
Uses actual newsreel footage to record the Australian soldier’s participation in the Second World War. Covers fighting in Libya, Greece, Crete, Syria and Tripoli, and the Singapore, New Guinea and Borneo campaigns.
